abstract: Mr. Hilton, an American, previously worked for Ford in Germany and Mazda in Japan before founding his design consulting firm, Motorcity Europe.
lead_paragraph: Bentley Motors has hired David Hilton as its head of exterior design. He succeeds Raul Pires, who was regarded a key player in the evolution of Bentley after its acquisition by the Volkswagen Group in 1998, along with the company's design and styling director, Dirk van Braeckel. Mr. Pires currently works at Italdesign Guigiaro, the consulting firm co-founded by Giorgetto Giugiaro, in which the VW Group purchased a controlling stake in 2010.

headline.main: David Hilton to Lead Exterior Design for Bentley
